page.title: 07Unemployment in Pontycymer
page.content: The decline of the industry was accompanied by pit closure and unemployment. In 1928, 71.7% of the Garw work force was unemployed, in 1938 66.7% . Today unemployment is still very high . 80% of school leavers are on the dole and unemployment is twice the national average. With unemployment, local shopkeepers have suffered, and dering the recent strike, shops were forced to close early on saturdays because of lack of trade. The only 3 large employers in Pontycymer are the two factories, Rexel and Flextank, and the one remaining colliery, the Garw. However, these only employ about 15% of the workforce, so large numbers of people are forced to commute to Bridgend, Cardiff and even further afield.
